results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: This compilation features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “The Pawnshop”: Chaplin stars as the pawnbroker’s assistant. “The Rink”: Chaplin as the waiter. “The Floorwalker” and “One A.M.”: Chaplin as the drunk.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London, of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight, he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads”, and worked throughout England and parts of Europe during his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned again in 1912-13 when he joined the Keystone company. This compilation features four of his short films, The Vagabond”, “The Fireman”, “The Count” and “Behind the Screen.

results.title: Charlie's angels [DVD]
results.creator_credit: McG, Drew Barrymore, Leonard Goldberg, Nancy Juvonen and Global Entertainment
results.brief_description: This big screen adaptation of the popular 70s TV series sees the return of the beautiful, brilliant and sassy angels who work for billionaire recluse, Charles Townsend. Together with their fellow colleague, Bosley, they are sent to work when an electronic genius, Eric Knox, is kidnapped. They soon discover even bigger problems are at bay when they realise Knox’s latest technology is a system which can monitor voice communication from anywhere in the world. This is an exuberant action comedy which never takes itself seriously, combining modern day themes with elements of 70s cheese. Cast includes: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Bill Murray, Sam Rockwell, Tim Curry, Kelly Lynch, Crispin Glover and the voice of John Forsythe as Charlie.

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just 'the tragedy queen' of Hindi film â€“ she also wrote poetry under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families and stage names to gendered disguises, this Constellation explores how women have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Child molestation: when to say no
results.creator_credit: Dana Young, Elizabeth Young and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses four dramatisations to illustrate typical encounters between a child and a child molester. Shows the child how to thwart the attempt of molestation and stresses the importance of reporting such incidents to a responsible adult. Suitable for middle and upper primary school levels.

results.title: Child care means business
results.creator_credit: Louise Leitch, Elena Guest and Commonwealth Department of Human Services and Health
results.brief_description: A panel of employers debate employer sponsored child care, examining economic arguments together with philosophical and practical issues. Andrew Olle hosts a panel including small, medium and big business along with leading work and family strategists.

results.title: Child abuse: the people next door
results.creator_credit: Dan Bessie, Helen Garvey and Shire Films
results.brief_description: This film helps parents recognise the potential for child abuse within themselves and others, the kinds of situations that can make that potential a reality, and how and where to find help.

results.title: Chicken run [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Nick Park, Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Aardman Chicken Run Ltd, NBCUniversal and Pathe Image Production
results.brief_description: Relying heavily on one of the most famous escape movies of all time - “The Great escape” (1963) - Aardman animations first feature length film has plenty to offer adults and children alike. Set on Tweedy’s poultry farm in the 1950’s, most of the inhabitants grumble about their lodgings but are paralysed by apathy, everyone that is except for Ginger, a feisty chicken who has come up with ingenious but ultimately unsuccessful escape plans. Their sheltered world is altered drastically when their is a new addition to their midst - Rocky, the flying rooster. Ginger, believing Rocky to be their salvation due to his capacity to fly (despite his gender), manages to convince him to whip the chickens into shape for a communal great escape. It turns into a race against time when the Tweedy’s plan to switch from egg production to chicken pies, which leaves little room to the imagination for how it will affect our poultry friends. Voices supplied by Mel Gibson, Julia Sawalha, Miranda Richardson and Timothy Spall.

results.title: Chicken ranch: a legal brothel in Nevada
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Broomfield, Sandi Sissel, Central Independent Television (UK) and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: A documentary film about the best known legalised brothel in America, the Chicken Ranch in Las Vegas. The film observes the day to day lives of the women who work in the brothel. Their average age is 21 and their earnings are split 50/50 with the house.
results.title_for_label: Chicken ranch: a legal brothel in Nevada

results.title: Charles Blackman: dreams and shadows
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, ABC-TV (Australia) and RM Films
results.brief_description: Charles Blackman has been described as the “traditional Aussie battler”. Raised by his mother in a home with no books and little furniture or food, Blackman rose above the insecurity of his life to become one of Australia’s most celebrated artists. A chronological look at Blackman’s life and work and his unique contribution to the development of the Australian identity is provided. Narrated by Kate Fitzpatrick.
